The Family Channel (KRPC-LP5) Rapid City, SD

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Midsomer St. Claire is rocked by murders that seem to be inspired by a macabre medieval fresco recently discovered in the church crypt.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Trixie speaks out on behalf of a patient, with mixed reactions. Dr. Turner and Sister Frances help a mother-to-be who refuses medical care. Nancy reveals a secret that could threaten her relationship with Nonnatus House.

programme.title: Masterpiece Mystery!
programme.desc: When the leader of a student group falls to her death during a protest, Will and Geordie are drawn into campus politics. The bishop introduces a new face at the vicarage.

programme.title: Masterpiece Classic
programme.desc: Emma's mission changes after a deadly discovery. And when Julien and Zsofia look to Kamilla and her husband, a new lead is uncovered, and a dramatic discovery is made.

programme.title: Masterpiece Mystery!
programme.desc: The best mystery and sleuth stories from Britain are presented.

programme.title: Masterpiece Mystery!
programme.desc: Searching for the secret to her father’s fate, Eliza goes to an abandoned prison. When the Duke joins her, they stumble on a nefarious criminal enterprise.

programme.title: Seaside Hotel
programme.desc: Fie is promoted to chambermaid on her first day which causes resentment. The guests include socialite Amanda and her parents who have a run-in with farmer Morten on the way to the hotel.

programme.title: Firing Line With Margaret Hoover
programme.desc: Bringing together the brightest minds and freshest voices from across the political spectrum to engage in a contest of ideas about important issues confronting our nation.

programme.title: To the Contrary
programme.desc: This program examines major issues with women of various ethnic and political backgrounds.

programme.title: Austin City Limits
programme.desc: Enjoy Texas artists from across the musical spectrum with Leon Bridges and Khruangbin. Fort Worth native Bridges performs modern R&B tunes from LP Gold-Diggers Sound. Houston trio Khruangbin plays worldbeat-tinged psych rock from its album Mordecai.

programme.title: The Oratorio: A Documentary With Martin Scorsese
programme.desc: Learn the long-forgotten story of the 1826 performance that brought Italian opera to New York City, and meet the colorful personalities involved, including a freed slave, opera's first diva, and Mozart's librettist.

programme.title: Da Ponte's Oratorio: A Concert for New York
programme.desc: An Italian opera company restages an oratorio last performed in 1826. Organized by Mozart's librettist Lorenzo Da Ponte, the 1826 event changed America's cultural landscape with the introduction of Italian opera to New York City.

programme.title: Finding Your Roots
programme.desc: Henry Louis Gates, Jr. provides comedians Lewis Black and Roy Wood, Jr. with accounts of hardship in their family trees which may have led them to each find humor in adversity.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: Featuring global news & current affairs, business, sports, science and technology trends.

programme.title: Classical Stretch: By Essentrics
programme.desc: Focus on overall health, wellness and physical fitness.

programme.title: BBC World News
programme.desc: A report on the day's international news from BBC correspondents around the globe.

programme.title: Xavier Riddle and the Secret Museum
programme.desc: Xavier goes back in time to meet spooky storyteller Mary Shelley before a Nature Troop campout.

programme.title: Hero Elementary
programme.desc: When a baby porcupine gets itself into predicaments, it's Sparks' Crew to the rescue. But, how do they help the little porcupine when they can't get too close to it?

programme.desc: While running an orange juice stand with Bill, George is fascinated by the special trucks a highway crew uses. Jumpy accidentally starts up a steamroller.
